note.p: Education: Educated by private tutors; Montpellier; Paris; Rheims; MD (1691)

Career: Accompanied the sons of the High Chancellor of Poland from England to Poland, via Italy and Austria; Physician to the court of King John Sobieski; accompanied the Princess Teresa Cunigunda from Warsaw to Brussels (1694); practised in London; lectured on anatomy in Oxford and London; wrote a history of Poland; a Roman Catholic, he apparently converted to Anglicanism and received the last rites of both churches; died of a fever
